Description: Wood writing tablet, with 27 lines of writing in ink. A strength report of the first cohort of Tungarians, including insights into their movements.
Curator's comments: 'Its strength report roughly follows the form we would expect from parallels in papyri from Egypt. But it is worth emphasising that this is the only known strength report from Britain and the only known example for a military cohort of auxiliary troops' (Bowman 2003, 16).
Bibliographic references: Tab. Vindol. II / The Vindolanda Writing Tablets (Tabulae Vindolandenses II) (154)
Bowman 2003 / Life and Letters on the Roman Frontier. Vindolanda and its people (p. 16)
